## Criteria for online source evaluation

-   **Audience**. For whom is this source intended?
-   **Accuracy**. Is the information in this source correct?
-   **Bias**. Does the information in the source support a particular agenda?
-   **Credibility**. Is the author an expert in this field?
-   **Currency**. Is the information up to date?

^Dal's handout: <https://tinyurl.com/mtz9372n>^

^Dal's libguide: <https://dal.ca.libguides.com/ResearchSkills/source-evaluation>^

## Practice

Compare the following pairs of sites and consider these questions:​​

-   What kind of site are you looking at?  Informational? Sales? Personal? Advocating for a cause?​
-   Who is responsible for the information?  Look for an ABOUT page.​
-   Which one is more appropriate for class assignments?​
-   Which is more credible?​
-   What factors helped you decide?​

^~source:<https://hennepintech.libguides.com/evaluatingwebsites>~ ​^
